name: UPTANE
tagline: Secure Over-The-Air Updates for Ground Vehicles
body:
# Description

UPTANE is an open-source project that aims to secure over-the-air software updates for ground vehicles. UPTANE is a collaboration between the New York University Tandon School of Engineering (NYU), the University of Michigan's Transport Research Institute (UMTRI), and the Southwest Research Institute (SWRI).

# Slides

* [SOTA Workshop #2: Strawman Design](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1z-IMQQz_2dJ3oeXWM4ky7023KrgTIhMtaHS8GpO4jF8/edit?usp=sharing)
* [SOTA Workshop #2: UPTANE design features](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1FRGEQM7_zX7m7xAzakf_vlDRWeZFRc5Flieol1OwUk4/edit?usp=sharing)
* [SOTA Workshop #2: UPTANE workflow, examples, and next steps](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1pFgOdK_GGPmwrh6yyaNB1b3Y_yPbS4jvAmq7yJS5bck/edit?usp=sharing)

# Documents

* [UPTANE Overview](https://docs.google.com/document/d/13XXQZ6KXCK_MiZj_Q84PQyMDmBiHnhEfgJgj8drKWRI/edit?usp=sharing)
* UPTANE RFC (coming soon)
* UPTANE deployment considerations (coming soon)

# Participation

* [Discussion forum](https://uptane.umtri.umich.edu/forum/)

# Acknowledgements

UPTANE is supported by U.S. Department of Homeland Security grants D15PC00239 and D15PC00302.
